data.title: Lee-Carter mortality forecasting: a multi-country comparison of variants and extensions
meta_keywords: Functional data; Lee-Carter method; mortality forecasting; nonparametric smoothing; principal components; state space.
authors: Heather Booth & Rob J Hyndman & Leonie Tickle & Piet de Jong
data.meta_description: Downloadable! We compare the short- to medium-term accuracy of five variants or extensions of the Lee-Carter method for mortality forecasting. These include the original Lee-Carter, the Lee-Miller and Booth-Maindonald-Smith variants, and the more flexible Hyndman-Ullah and De Jong-Tickle extensions. These methods are compared by applying them to sex-specific populations of 10 developed countries using data for 1986-2000 for evaluation. All variants and extensions are more accurate than the original Lee-Carter method for forecasting log death rates, by up to 61%. However, accuracy in log death rates does not necessarily translate into accuracy in life expectancy. There are no significant differences among the five methods in forecast accuracy for life expectancy.
